title: Shrinking and Disclaimer keep pulling in plenty of viewers
description: The Apple TV+ comedy “Shrinking” and the sexy drama “Disclaimer” continue to pull in big audiences, as does Billy Crystal’s thriller series. (via Cult of Mac - Apple news, rumors, reviews and how-tos)
author: Ed Hardy
excerpt: The Apple TV+ comedy “Shrinking” and the sexy drama “Disclaimer” continue to pull in big audiences, as does Billy Crystal’s thriller series.
text: News “Shrinking” has been a consistent hit for Apple TV+. Photo: Apple TV+ The Apple TV+ dramedy Shrinking stayed among the top 10 most popular streaming series last week, according to two ratings companies. And the sexy drama Disclaimer did well for another week, too. In addition, Billy Crystal’s thriller series Before found an audience. Shrinking is a hit… again Apple TV+ isn’t the largest of the streaming services — that’s honor goes to Netflix and Amazon Prime Video. But Apple’s smaller service nevertheless manages to regularly produce hits by hiring top talent… like a beloved film star making the jump to the small screen. Shrinking season one was a success for Apple TV+, and when season 2 premiered on the streaming service its audience from last year came back immediately. The comedy/drama starring Jason Segel and Harrison Ford holds the No. 8 spot on the JustWatch list of popular series for the week of Oct. 28 – Nov. 3. And it’s at No. 9 on the  Reelgood list of Top 10 TV shows the week of October 31 – Nov. 6. Several Apple TV+ series did well with audiences last week: Shrinking, Disclaimer and Before.Chart: JustWatch/Reelgood Estimates from companies like JustWatch and Reelgood are necessary because streaming services rarely reveal how many people tune in to their offerings. Apple’s official description of the series says: “Shrinking follows a grieving therapist (played by Segel) who starts to break the rules and tell his clients exactly what he thinks. Ignoring his training and ethics, he makes huge, tumultuous changes to people’s lives … including his own.” That could be the description for a drama, but the show generally plays with the premise for laughs. It’s a feel-good comedy with a dose of drama. The first five episodes of Shrinking season two can be enjoyed now, while the sixth is coming on Wednesday. Watch to catch up? Season one is ready to be binge-watched. Cate Blanchett’s Disclaimer stays a hit With so many big names involved in Disclaimer —Cate Blanchett, Kevin Kline, Alfonso Cuarón and more — there was enormous pressure on the series to be a success. And it’s clearly delivering. Disclaimer holds the No. 7 spot on Reelgood’s popularity chart from last week, and it’s been in the top 10 since it premiered. If the series’ popularity gets piques your interest, the Apple TV+ summary says: “Acclaimed journalist Catherine Ravenscroft (Blanchett) built her reputation revealing the misdeeds and transgressions of others. When she receives a novel from an unknown author, she is horrified to realize she is now the main character in a story that exposes her darkest secrets and threatens to destroy her family. “As Catherine races to uncover the writer’s true identity, she is forced to confront her past before it destroys her life and her relationships with her husband Robert (Baron Cohen) and son Nicholas (Kodi Smit-McPhee). The ensemble cast includes Kline, Lesley Manville, Louis Partridge, Leila George and Hoyeon, and features Indira Varma as the narrator.” The seventh and final episode of Disclaimer is ready to watch now on Apple TV+. The entire series is now ready to binge watch. Before finds an audience And those two Apple TV+ series aren’t alone on the popularity charts. Billy Crystal’s Before sits on JustWatch’s streaming series popularity chart in the No. 9 slot. Despite what you might expect from this actor, this is no comedy. It’s a psychological thriller and a “supernatural mystery,” Here’s how the streamer describes the 10-episode limited series’s plot and cast: Before stars Crystal as Eli, a child psychiatrist who, after recently losing his wife, Lynn (Judith Light), encounters a troubled young boy, Noah (Jacobi Jupe), who seems to have a haunting connection to Eli’s past. As Eli attempts to help Noah, their mysterious bond deepens. Alongside Crystal, the supernatural mystery series stars Emmy and Tony Award winner Judith Light, Jacobi Jupe, Emmy Award nominee Rosie Perez, Tony Award nominee Maria Dizzia and Ava Lalezarzadeh. The first four episodes of Before are ready to watch now on Apple TV+. The next will premiere on the streaming service on Friday. Watch these and more on Apple TV+ Streaming Disclaimer, Shrinking and Before, plus many other series or films comes with a subscription to Apple TV+. The service is $9.99 per month with a seven-day free trial. You can also get it via any tier of the Apple One subscription bundle. And Apple’s streaming video service also includes much more, of course. There’s a library of drama, comedies, musicals, children’s shows, nature documentaries, etc.
html:
• News

The Apple TV+ dramedy Shrinking stayed among the top 10 most popular streaming series last week, according to two ratings companies. And the sexy drama Disclaimer did well for another week, too.

In addition, Billy Crystal’s thriller series Before found an audience.

Shrinking is a hit… again

Apple TV+ isn’t the largest of the streaming services — that’s honor goes to Netflix and Amazon Prime Video. But Apple’s smaller service nevertheless manages to regularly produce hits by hiring top talent… like a beloved film star making the jump to the small screen.

Shrinking season one was a success for Apple TV+, and when season 2 premiered on the streaming service its audience from last year came back immediately. The comedy/drama starring Jason Segel and Harrison Ford holds the No. 8 spot on the JustWatch list of popular series for the week of Oct. 28 – Nov. 3. And it’s at No. 9 on the  Reelgood list of Top 10 TV shows the week of October 31 – Nov. 6.

Estimates from companies like JustWatch and Reelgood are necessary because streaming services rarely reveal how many people tune in to their offerings.

Apple’s official description of the series says:

“Shrinking follows a grieving therapist (played by Segel) who starts to break the rules and tell his clients exactly what he thinks. Ignoring his training and ethics, he makes huge, tumultuous changes to people’s lives … including his own.”

That could be the description for a drama, but the show generally plays with the premise for laughs. It’s a feel-good comedy with a dose of drama.

The first five episodes of Shrinking season two can be enjoyed now, while the sixth is coming on Wednesday. Watch to catch up? Season one is ready to be binge-watched.

Cate Blanchett’s Disclaimer stays a hit

With so many big names involved in Disclaimer —Cate Blanchett, Kevin Kline, Alfonso Cuarón and more — there was enormous pressure on the series to be a success. And it’s clearly delivering. Disclaimer holds the No. 7 spot on Reelgood’s popularity chart from last week, and it’s been in the top 10 since it premiered.

If the series’ popularity gets piques your interest, the Apple TV+ summary says:

“Acclaimed journalist Catherine Ravenscroft (Blanchett) built her reputation revealing the misdeeds and transgressions of others. When she receives a novel from an unknown author, she is horrified to realize she is now the main character in a story that exposes her darkest secrets and threatens to destroy her family.

“As Catherine races to uncover the writer’s true identity, she is forced to confront her past before it destroys her life and her relationships with her husband Robert (Baron Cohen) and son Nicholas (Kodi Smit-McPhee). The ensemble cast includes Kline, Lesley Manville, Louis Partridge, Leila George and Hoyeon, and features Indira Varma as the narrator.”

The seventh and final episode of Disclaimer is ready to watch now on Apple TV+. The entire series is now ready to binge watch.

Before finds an audience

And those two Apple TV+ series aren’t alone on the popularity charts. Billy Crystal’s Before sits on JustWatch’s streaming series popularity chart in the No. 9 slot.

Despite what you might expect from this actor, this is no comedy. It’s a psychological thriller and a “supernatural mystery,” Here’s how the streamer describes the 10-episode limited series’s plot and cast:

Before stars Crystal as Eli, a child psychiatrist who, after recently losing his wife, Lynn (Judith Light), encounters a troubled young boy, Noah (Jacobi Jupe), who seems to have a haunting connection to Eli’s past. As Eli attempts to help Noah, their mysterious bond deepens.

Alongside Crystal, the supernatural mystery series stars Emmy and Tony Award winner Judith Light, Jacobi Jupe, Emmy Award nominee Rosie Perez, Tony Award nominee Maria Dizzia and Ava Lalezarzadeh.

The first four episodes of Before are ready to watch now on Apple TV+. The next will premiere on the streaming service on Friday.

Watch these and more on Apple TV+

Streaming Disclaimer, Shrinking and Before, plus many other series or films comes with a subscription to Apple TV+. The service is $9.99 per month with a seven-day free trial. You can also get it via any tier of the Apple One subscription bundle.

And Apple’s streaming video service also includes much more, of course. There’s a library of drama, comedies, musicals, children’s shows, nature documentaries, etc.
